Maternal exposure during pregnancy, gestation period 24 weeks; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 20-year-old pregnant female patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm on 24May2021 at 10:45 (at the age of 20-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included celiac disease, allergic to latex, bee venom, gluten and shellfish. The patient's last menstrual date was on 11Dec2020 and delivery date was reported as 17Sep2021. Concomitant medications were not reported.  Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 24May2021, the patient experienced maternal exposure during pregnancy, gestation period 24 weeks. The clinical outcome of the event maternal exposure during pregnancy was unknown at the time of this report.   No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained. No further information is expected

fast heartbeat/heart rate was too high; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (parent). A 20-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported, NDC number and Expiry date were not provided), via an unspecified route of administration on 05Apr2021 at the age of 20-years-old as dose 1, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient reported on behalf of her daughter (patient) who received the 1st dose of the Pfizer covid vaccine on Monday, 5Apr2021. The previous day, she went to donate blood as she usually does. However, she was denied due to a fast heartbeat on an unspecified date. She hasn't ever been declined in the past. She walked to the place as she usually does. Stated that they told her that her heart rate was too high on an unspecified date. Stated that they took it a second time and it was too high for them to take her blood. Stated that her daughter normally has low blood pressure like her and had to stay there afterwards for a little while so she will not pass out. The reporter wanted to know if the heart rate would be associated with the blood pressure. Wanted to know if this could be from the vaccine even though she had it back on 05Apr. Clarified that she had the Covid 19 vaccination. Wanted to know if her daughter needed to go and get this checked out. patient would like to know whether her daughter should ask the vaccination provider to take her blood pressure when she returns for the 2nd dose of the covid vaccine and was Informed that it is not a recommendation of Pfizer's but she may request it at the vaccination providers discretion. Patient wanted to know whether her daughters side effect: a fast heartbeat, was related to the covid vaccine. Patient would like to know whether there are any reporting to do for her daughters experience. Reporter seriousness for heart rate was too high was unspecified. The outcome of event was unknown.  No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

My left arm was very sore when I went to bed and I couldn't lift it without help. Around 1am, I woke up feeling sweaty, hot and cold. It felt like a fever with chills. My arm was hurting worse than before and I had a terrible headache. I couldn't sleep for the rest of the night. Around 7am, I got up and took 2 tablets of acetaminophen. It relieved my headache and some of the pain in my arm. I'm very tired and moving slowly.

Patient experienced skin itching post-Pfizer #1. She indicated she is allergic to latex and Benadryl, and had a previous reaction to the pneumococcal vaccine. Itching did not progress to hives at the vaccine site. Her blood pressure was elevated (she has hx of HTN):  22/113; 225/116; 219/114 (over 30 minutes); HR 80, RR 18 per EMS report. No PSO2 assessed. She declined EMS transport. She was counseled by a health department RN to discuss the reaction with her doctor prior to receiving the second vaccine.

Patient was standing in pharmacy lobby after receiving Moderna vaccine during observation period. At about the 10 minute point, he fainted and fell to the floor. I attended him within about 45 seconds. he was conscious, but confused. Pharmacy staff called 911, and he was attended by myself and a physician assistant who was shopping. Paramedics arrived in less than 10 minutes. Patient was treated by paramedics for about 20 minutes and was determined to be unhurt from the fall, and had recovered from his episode of syncope. He was released into the care of his mother, who was in store with him.

On 21-Jan-2021, the patient received dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) at an unspecified dose. At the time of the report, INJECTION SITE PAIN (arm was sore), HEADACHE (headache), INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (flu-like symptoms), VACCINATION SITE ERYTHEMA (injection site was very red), RASH (rash), PRURITUS (itchy) and VACCINATION SITE WARMTH (very hot to touch) had not resolved.        The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown Route) was unknown. Cholesterol little elevated; Vitamin D two points low; just about face planted; dizziness worsened; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer sponsored program from a contactable consumer (patient). A 42-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Lot number: EL8982 or E68982), intramuscular on 13Jan2021 16:00 at single dose in left deltoid for COVID-19 immunisation. Patient age at time of vaccination was 42 years. Medical history included retinal blood clot in his retina which was why he was tested for rheumatoid arthritis (RA), and Meniere's disease for which he was asked to try meclizine which was for inner ear but he did not start taking meclizine, and six years ago, they did blood work and he was told he may have RA or he may have markers for RA but he has had no further issues and does not take any medication for this. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported.  Historical vaccine included  influenza immunisation (flu shot) in Sep2020 and first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number: EK9231) administered on 22Dec2020 around 15:15 at single dose intramuscular injection in left deltoid, and on 06Jan2021 he started to experience dizziness/feeling dizzy and going to throw up on 11Jan2021. He received the second dose of the Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine on 13Jan2021 and for the last days it seems that the dizziness is being incrementing, reported as worsened. His physician recommended him to perform laboratory tests and the results came back without abnormal findings except for cholesterol and vitamin D. He was told his cholesterol was a little elevated and his vitamin D was two points low, regarding his lab work. He got a vitamin D supplement which he started to take. He will start on his cholesterol medication today that was prescribed. Reportedly he has a Roomba and when he went to go press the button for it, he just about face planted. He looked online and could not find anything about the dizziness aside from dizziness could be a sign of a severe allergic reaction. He does not have hypotension or anything like that. Dizziness was not resolved, while outcome of other events was unknown. It was stated dizziness is not reported as a side effect of the vaccine.

vaccine was shipped on 30-Oct-2019 and delivered on 04-NOV-2019, had a shipment delay, no AE; Initial information received on 04-Nov-2019 regarding an unsolicited valid non-serious case received from a nurse.  This case is linked to cases 2019SA308920, 2019SA308921, and 2019SA309165 (same reporter).  This case involves a 72 years old female patient who received a 0.5 mL dose of vaccine INFLUENZA USP TRIVAL A-B HIGH DOSE SUBVIRION VACCINE [FLUZONE HIGH DOSE] (lot UJ290AB, Exp. Date 09-Jun-2020) via intramuscular route in the right deltoid on 04-Nov-2019 that had a shipment delay.  The patient's past medical history, medical treatment(s), vaccination(s) and family history were not provided.  It was an actual medication error case due to incorrect product storage.  It was reported that the vaccines were shipped 30-Oct-2019 and were delivered this morning 04-Nov-2019. She has taken care of the replacements. Before they received the email, 1 dose of Fluzone Quadrivalent and 3 doses of Fluzone High Dose had been administered to patients.  At the time of reporting, no adverse event was reported.  This suspected adverse reaction report is submitted and classified as a medication error solely and exclusively to ensure the marketing authorization holder's compliance with the requirements set out in Directive 2001/83/EC and Module VI of the Good Pharmacovigilance Practices. The classification as a medical error is in no way intended, nor should it be interpreted or construed as an allegation or claim made by the marketing authorization holder that any third party has contributed to or is to be held liable for the occurrence of this medication error.

I couldn't sleep, eat only a little and really really bad for 24 hours. I took Tylenol 1000 every 8 hours. The second night I could sleep and today I am feeling almost normal. I know that my symptoms are kind of normal but the shaking part I don't know why, anyway I only want to report. I didn't need to contact my doctor and I am okay now. Thank you!

Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Systemic: FAINTING BUT ABLE TO HEAR & RESPONSE IN FAINT VOICE-Medium, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Visual Changes/Disturbances-Severe, Additional Details: AFTER ABOUT 5 MIN OF INJECTION, PT COMPLAINT THAT HE COULDN'T SEE ANYTHING. HE HAD MORE SWEATING & WEAK.  MOM TRIED TO WAKE HIM. HE DID RESPONSE IN FAINT VOICE. I HAD THE TECH CALLED 911 & I GAVE EPINEPHRINE INJECTION. FEW MINUTES LATER, HE SAID THAT HE COULD SEE. THE RESCUE MEMBERS CAME & MEASURED BP & HR WHICH WAS NORMAL SO THEY DIDN'T TAKE HIM TO ER. I CALLED MOM LATER & SHE SAID HE GOT BACK TO NORMAL. I ALSO TRIED TO FOLLOW UP FEW TIMES ON FOLLOWING DAYS BUT NO ONE ANSWERED THE PHONE.

I received my 2nd dose of Moderna, but have some concerns about where the shot was given on my arm. After I got home, I noticed the injection site was too low. Per my research, this vaccine should be administered as an intramuscular injection in the deltoid muscle. However, here's a photo where I've annotated with a red dot where I got my shot, it's too low (below the armpit line) and a little far back.    I believe the injection was in the tricep (I felt the soreness in the tricep) rather than the deltoid. Since the shot was given at the wrong site, I am reporting this as a vaccination administration error.

Pleurisy of my lungs, or known as Pleuritis.  I was treated but undiagnosed in the ER. I experienced sudden sharp chest pain and shortness of breath. I thought it was a cardiac event. The ER did not figure out what it was. My doctor was able to diagnose it a day or so later. Almost 3 full weeks now and I still have symptoms, mostly pain in my chest.
Ringing in both ears.  Both ears feel clogged.  Hard to hear.   Vertigo Chills and aches (which I expected)

I am still having episodes of positional vertigo if I move suddenly. It has been eight weeks. I have never had any Vertigo before.

I got both my Covid shots in my right arm, and about two weeks after the second shot, in late March, my right ear began hissing, chirping, and ringing and hasn't stopped since.  I've been trying every type of treatment I can think of, seeing my doctor and his assistant numerous times, hoping it was due to an ongoing ear infection I had at the time that affected my ear  drum, but it's becoming more clear that it is from the shots, and seems to be permanent nerve damage.

Patient fainted after vaccination while he was seated during the 15 minute observation window.  Patient quickly recovered (less than 1 minute) but was feeling cold and clammy.  Patient was given water to rehydrate and stay seated for observation; Pt did not require EMS to be called as he recovered quickly on his own.  Patient left with his friends when he recovered. A follow-up phone call to the patient was made a few hours after vaccination and patient was doing well.  Patient instructed to rest up and contact MD if needed.

Started having vertigo early morning of 3/23. Got up to walk to the bathroom and needed to hold onto the walls as my balance was   way off. This has continued since then off and on. Seems to be better in the PM and almost gone but when I sleep it comes back every morning. It occurs mostly when walking but if I move my head too quickly when sitting I will also get dizzy. I did go to the UCC on 3/25 and was dx with benign [paroxysmal vertigo and mild right ear infection. I do have nystagmus when I tilt my head to the right at times. I have been taking Meclizine 25mg q8hrs and Doxycycline q12hrs but with only minimla change in the dizziness. I did see online other report also having dizziness after the vaccine so wanted to send in this report.

Pt received second dose moderna vaccine. Did not bring first dose vaccine card, unable to obtain first dose lot number and date of vaccination from patient. Pt left facility and upon approaching stop light in front of building, pt began to experience SOB with fast heart rate and mouth dryness. Pt returned to facility to seek medical attention. Brought to med obs #1 via wheelchair by staff for evaluation. Reports mild improvement of symptoms upon arrival to med obs. No s/s of distress noted upon pt arrival. Pt reports taking prescribed lisinopril PTA this AM. Upon assessment of VS, BP elevated. Pt states he occasionally has SBP 200+/DBP 100+. Denies s/s of anxiety at present and denies headache/vision changes. VS are as follows: 1314: BP 187/107 (RUE), rechecked on LUE 233/134, HR 75, RR 17, O2 sat 98% on RA. 1319: BP 233/118 (LUE), rechecked on RUE 242/122, HR 104, RR 16, O2 sat 99% on RA. Per VS parameters, pt qualifies for EMS transport for ER evaluation of elevated BP. Notified in-house PA of need for assessment and confirmation of EMS need for transport as well as notification to lead supervisor. Constable at employee entrance notified to assist in arriving EMS. Upon assessment of pt by PA, pt disclosed he is non-compliant with prescribed lisinopril at home and will occasionally use medication PRN or double/triple his dosage based on symptoms. PA provided education on proper use of lisinopril and confirmed need for higher level of care. Pt agreeable to EMS transport for further evaluation. 9-1-1 called. While awaiting EMS arrival, pt reported sweating of hands and shallow breathing, stating, "I feel like I have to concentrate on my breathing now." Pt not in distress. EMS arrived to transport pt to Hospital. Pt alert and oriented x4 and ambulatory from stretcher to EMS gurney upon transfer.  VS while awaiting EMS arrival are as follows: 1324: BP 249/126, HR 83, RR 17, O2 sat 100% on RA 1329: BP 247/109, HR 85, RR 18, O2 sat 100% on RA 1336: BP  243/112, HR 84, RR 20, O2 sat 100% on RA 1347: BP 245/144, HR 87, RR 18, O2 sat 100% on RA

Patient reported to immunizing technician before administration of vaccine that he had a history of fainting post-vaccination due to anxiety and nerve about needles. Pt stated that previously he had fainted immediately post-vaccination. After discussing patient's medical history the supervising pharmacist advised pt to stay in vaccination seat for direct observation for 10-15min. After about 10 minutes post-vaccination in observation period the pt alerted immunizing tech, "oh, its happening." The tech brought a wet paper towel and placed it on the back of patient's neck and pt replied, "oh, that feels good", then patient's head immediately dropped and he went out of consciousness. Pharmacist witnessed event and rushed over to support patient from falling off chair. Pharmacist was rubbing and patting patients back and chest, yelling his name to arouse him. Pharmacist directed tech to call code white and alert store manager. In total, the patient was approximately in and out of consciousness about 20 seconds. Pt responded to stimulus and recovered without other effects or injury. Patient was fully responsive and aware of event went he became conscious again. We offered him a cold water bottle and encouraged him to remove mask if it helped him to breath better. Pt was able to communicate with pharmacist about the sensations he had leading to the event where he described first tingling in his feet, than dissociation from body, where he felt like he was having a dream but could hear someone yelling at him. EMS arrived at the scene and performed vital check. Based on patient abnormal hypertension at scene and higher BMI, EMS offered to transport patient to the ED for further tests and observation but patient declined. Patient was accompanied by his emergency contact, his father (who also witnessed the events unfold).

1) After midnight, I began to get what felt like the shivers, but they were unlike anything I had ever seen or experienced, as I could not stop shaking, feeling like I had to try to get warm.  I had a heat pack under my back, and no temperature, but for 25 minutes, kept shaking. 2) At 10am in the morning, I began hallucinating, which has never happened to me before, and I only recognize because when my Dad was dying of prostate cancer, they had him on morphine and he began to see things.  It was a very specific hallucination, of being in a specific from in front of a specific computer talking to a person.  I feel quite reluctant to share this.  This lasted for somewhere between 30 and 45 minutes. 3) I've vomited once, and had diarrhea, drinking lots of water, and only using Tylenol.  I did not take the Tylenol until after I stopped shivering.

The patient presented to the Emergency Department several hours after receiving their first dose of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine. EMS evaluated at the vaccine site, but the patient refused transport and elected to drive themselves. In the ED, the patient reported heart palpitations, "seeing spots", chest discomfort, itching on their chest, and HTN. On presentation, the patient was tachycardic (120bpm) and hypertensive (185/95). The patient's labs and tests were not concerning, and the physician stated the patient was well-appearing and in no acute distress. The patient was discharged with diagnoses of possible reaction Pfizer COVID vaccine, Possible anxiety response, and Hypertension. The physician instructed the patient to regularly check their blood pressure and follow-up with their PCP.
None stated.

Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient experienced feel "foggy" on Mar2021 with outcome of recovering, stroke on 14Mar2021 20:30 with outcome of recovering. 12 days after vaccine experienced closing of throat; difficulty breathing; vocal chord dysfunction; excessive congestions; sore throat; cough; bloody noses; fatigue. Went to urgent care and confirmed negative Covid-19 and negative strep test. Saw campus clinician on May-24 and determined "just allergies." Saw primary physician on May-17 . Also confirmed allergies but severity of symptoms not typical for patient who has been on immunotherapy for years  for seasonal allergies.. Initiated aggressive allergy treatment with medications and when symptoms got worse instead of better wad finally put on oral steroids. And then also required a course of antibiotics. Illness lasted almost 3 weeks.

I recieved my second dose of the Moderna vaccine on 3/6/21 at 3pm and by 9am on 3/7/21 I had a fever of 101.6 and it would spike up to 102.6 going up and down over the next 2 days. I experienced a high fever that only decreased to a low fever of 100.5 with ibuprofen and cool baths and cold fluids for two days. The injection site was swollen and painful for 3 days just like the first vaccine, but the fever and full body aches accompanied by once of the worst light sensitive headache I have ever experienced lasted for 2 days. The 3rd day was interesting, my fever broke and my lower back now ached very bad and I was weak to stand. The most interesting thing that happened on the third day was a full badly rash that looked and felt like a full body sunburn. My fever had broken, but my skin was bright red and radiated heat of 101.5, but my head temp read normal 98.6 The red sunburn skin cut off dramatically at my wrists. I took pictures because it was so bizarre looking. By Wednesday morning the rash/sunburn was almost 70% gone and I was starting to feel like a normal human being again.  I would like to note that I had a very mild fever 99.9 with my first vaccine shot and my arm was very sore and swollen for 3 days. My mom is 65 years old and received the first dose of Moderna's vaccine last Saturday, 2/6. On Tuesday, 2/9 (three days after the vaccination), she saw red and purple bruises across her left arm - the arm where the vaccine was injected. Nothing occurred to cause the bruises across her left arm. There was also one large bruise on her left leg but that was caused by bumping her leg into an object.   My mom went to her PCP today for bloodwork. We hope to get results from Quest tomorrow.   My mom has received various vaccinations throughout life and this reaction is unprecedented. The day after she received the COVID-19 vaccine, she had a fever, dizziness, low blood pressure and slow heartbeat. All these side effects disappeared by Tuesday (three days after vaccination) but the bruises appeared.

On 03 Jan 2021 prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 011L20A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection.   On 03 Jan 2021, prior to receiving mRNA-1273, the patient felt itchy and like her face had been punched on the left side. On 06 Jan 2021 she felt her face looked droopy on the left side. Her dimple came back in her face. On 21 Jan 2021 her eyes was droopy and can see a line on one side, and other side doesn't have a line. It's gotten better with acupuncture. She gets acupuncture and electrostimulation; she had a horrible reaction to steroids. Her eye was stuck open for 3 months, she had a patch. Treatment for the events include 3 sessions of acupuncture. The outcome of events, pruritis, facial pain and facial paralysis was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Saturday April 10 - Immediately after receiving injection in left arm I had great pain and felt the warm sensation moving up my shoulder, I remained at the facility for 15 minutes and took 2 Tylenol before leaving the parking lot and driving the hour back home.  At 5:00pm I took two more Tylenol, at 8:00pm the fever began, along with feeling very achy, rapid heartbeat and breathing slightly heavy. The rapid heartbeat lasted for about 11 hours. At one point my heart rate was 102 beats per minute.  The fever Sunday April 11 stayed at 101.1-101.4,  At tines I felt of balance, my throat is very sore and I had a stuffy nose, Could barely keep my eyes open.  Monday April 12, fever has broke  but now I have a rash on my face and other areas of my body.   I did not go to the ER or doctor

Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: patient presented with abdominal pain and nausea  and admitted for anticoagulation (heparin) and monitoring for SMV thrombus. Patient developed fever to 40 degrees Celsius and underwent diagnostic laparoscopy with evidence of recovering ischemia of the jejunum and omental adhesion along the left abdomen. Found to have left upper extremity superficial thrombophlebitis concerning for early suppurative complications in setting of persistent fevers and mild thrombocytopenia. Heparin discontinued when thrombocytopenia developed and platelet counts have increased.

The day after my second shot I got a fever and felt run down through that day, that evening I developed diarrhea which lasted until the following day. All of this I expected from what I had heard that some people have after the second shot. But what I didn't expect was from then until now which has been approximately 6 weeks I am cramped and my lower abdomen everyday and I'm also experiencing atrial fibrillation almost constantly which I've never done before. All my episodes with a fib in the past were due to times when I had been very nauseous or very cramped and would go into a fib which lasted 10 12 hours but for the last 12 years I've been on atenolol for that and it has kept me from experiencing those problems. But since the second shot I'm experiencing atrial fibrillation like I said every day with the cramping which I've never had before to that extent. I'm reporting this because something isn't quite right and if this is a coincidence it's a pretty good one. Thank you for reading this and if I can be of any further help please feel free to contact me through my email.

On January 21, 2021 at the Clinic, a PA was administering vaccinations during the morning for a four-hour shift, 8 AM to noon. At the end of her shift, she handed off her vaccines to another vaccinator. The PA had three doses of vaccine drawn up at that time, in syringes, on her desk. When the RN inspected the syringes, she found 0.4mL of vaccine had been drawn into those syringes rather than the required 0.3mL. The nurse then alerted the APRN, who escalated the situation to the manager. The operations manager then contacted Quality. The concern was that the PA had been vaccinating patients all morning with an inappropriate dose of vaccine, 0.4mL. After thorough internal investigation, we found that the PA drew up 38 vaccine doses and administered 35 of them. Additionally, based on vial usage for the day and total number of vaccines administered, we have concluded that it is highly unlikely that excess vaccine was administered. This was a near miss event and is being reported out of an abundance of care.

The patient's concurrent conditions included cigarette smoker, no alcohol use, penicillin allergy, high blood pressure, and lower back pain from bone loss after menopause, and patient had no drug abuse or illicit drug usage. The patient was previously treated with ibuprofen for drug allergy. The patient received covid-19 vaccine ad26.cov2.s (suspension for injection, route of admin not reported, batch number: 204A21a and expiry: 07-AUG-2021) dose was not reported, 1 total, administered on 01-JUN-2021 to left arm for prophylactic vaccination.  Concomitant medications included lisinopril, and oxycodone.  On 27-JUN-2021, The patient had a stroke and patient states that, mouth felt different and went to take a drink and it ran down the mouth, patient's whole right side of face was paralyzed, patient drove to the hospital and patient was scans performed in the emergency room (ER), was given a diagnosis of Bell's Palsy and a referral to a neurologist. The patient was told that a stroke could not be ruled out, and patient was not admitted to hospital and was discharged from emergency room (ER) around 1:30 am on 28-JUN-2021. The patient was contacted primary doctor and a referral for a neurologist was sent and patient was awaiting a call back with appointment information and reports symptoms have not improved including feeling the right side of face being paralyzed and being unable to close right eye. Laboratory data included: Lab test (NR: not provided) Patient willing to provide reports if requested. The action taken with covid-19 vaccine ad26.cov2.s was not applicable. The patient had not recovered from stroke and bell's palsy. This report was serious (Other Medically Important Condition).; Sender's Comments: V0: 20210700241-covid-19 vaccine ad26.cov2.s-possible stroke, bell's palsy. This event(s) is considered unassessable. The event(s) has a compatible/suggestive temporal relationship, is unlabeled, and has unknown scientific plausibility. There is no information on any other factors potentially associated with the event(s).

Severe bone pain lasting approximately 16 hours, beginning at around 01:00am the day following the vaccine (2nd dose). It felt like when you hit your elbow too hard and get both a deep, dull, aching pain, and a burning, shooting nerve pain. I experienced it down both arms and both legs, with the leg pain lasting longer and feeling more severe than the arm pain. I also experienced muscle spasms in my arms, legs, and lower back, with nerve pain shooting from my lower back into my legs, almost like sciatica. The pain was between a 7 or 8/10 at most times and was some of the worst pain I?ve continuously felt in my life. The pain subsided around 16 hours after starting, however I?m still experiencing occasional shooting pain or sudden aching in my bones or muscle spasms, although it?s usually only one area at a time and very brief/manageable. During the 16 hours, I also had joint stiffness that was severe enough to limit my ability to move and I had difficulty walking to the bathroom or shifting positions in bed. It also mostly subsided after the 16 hours, however I am still experiencing minor joint stiffness still.

Rapid, strong heartbeats felt in neck and head woke me at approx 4:30 a.m. Blood pressure was 185/102. Took BP meds (.5 mg Ramipril and 25 mg hydrochlorothiazide). Waited 15 minutes and BP was 167/101. Waited another 15 minutes and BP was 149/91. Saw doctors PA in the afternoon, BP was 162/81.  PA administered EKG, blood work, and spent a significant amount of time listening to heart, lungs and carotid arteries. Everything was in normal range except sugars, but an A1C test was normal.  PA said to take an extra Ramipril at night and track BP at home for 7 days.  BP went down each day and on  2/26 was in normal range. However, after 7 days, she said to permanently stay on the evening addition of Ramipril.

Patient received the 1st dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine  and was being observed for the 30 minute observation due to history of :severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis) as a child, with unknown etiology. About 20 minutes into the observation period patient began complaining of tightness in her chest and heaviness in her shoulders.  respiratory rate = 20 and unlabored; breathing spontaneously with O2 saturation 100% on room air; BP 116/69, Pulse 103 Mentation: Alert Skin: Cool   at onset of symptoms, per EMS recommendation, the patient was placed on oxygen 2 liters via nasal canulaO2 saturations remained at 100 %. Patient noted slight improvement of her symptoms after about 15 minutes with oxygen continuing at 2 liters/Nasal cannula. Continued to observe patient for another 10 minutes, after which time the patient began to complain of a scratchy feeling in her throat, swelling around her mouth, itching and flushing of her face. At 19:05, EMS administered  0.3 mg intramuscular, Epinephrine via auto-injector into patient's right thigh.  After 5-6 minutes post-Epi administration, the patient reported having relief of symptoms. Vital signs obtained (BP 108/69, pulse 108) and oxygen saturation stable at 100% on room air. Patient was advised, she would need further evaluation in the Emergency Department after receiving the dose of Epinephrine via auto-injector. Patient was advised to be transported via ambulance. Patient declined transport via ambulance. Patient called a friend to give her a ride to the Emergency Department. EMS personnel called report to the ED. Patient was alert, oriented x3 throughout the adverse event and stable upon leaving the clinic at 40 minutes after Epi had been administered. Vaccine providers were notified of the adverse symptoms post vaccine. Patient will follow-up with her primary provider and allergy provider to determine if second dose will be a possibility to receive.

Intense pain at the site of injection and stiffness in RT shoulder area. As time went on pain increased and shoulder "froze"--could not be moved without excruciating pain. Ice helped the pain somewhat. After 24 hours of continuing negative progression began taking BENADRYL and Acetaminophen 500 mg. This made me so sleepy I could not stay up so went to bed and slept. Would wake up about every 5 hrs and repeated meds. 24 hrs after injection a red rash began on the upper arm near the shoulder joint. Continued taking BENADRYL and rash began fading after 24 hrs on med. Mild headache eventually set in and nightmares while sleeping. 6 days later arm is still slightly sore when moved or try to lift something heavy. Headache is better but still feel foggy--have stopped BENADRYL but continue Acetaminophen once daily. I did call urgent care and was told this is "normal" even though the paperwork the Dr office gave me said it is not and to call my doctor if these things happened. Heat has helped relax the shoulder. General over-all achiness is slowly dissipating.

Pt received his second dose of Moderna at :10 am on 4-8-21.  At approx 9:15 he started to feel weak and light headed, stating he felt like he was going to pass out.  Asked if he could lay down.  Took him into the counseling room, placed him on the floor and elevated his legs. We went to get him a cold water and an ice pak for his headache.  Pt laid there for 5 more minutes then sat up and we gave him two sugar cookies.  Pt gradually stood up to sit upright in a chair. He drank another cold water and we observed him for 30 more minutes.  Approx 9:45 am Pt stated he was feeling much better and was ready to go home.  He did have a driver with him whom walked him out to the car and got him to his residence.  Upon 5:30 pm on 4-8-21 pt had not experienced anymore symptoms besides tiredness,  He was counseled to go to the ER if he experience any other unusual occurences.

Exactly two weeks after the 2nd covid shot, to the hour, my eyes became puffy and swollen. Eyelids, under eye, between eyes - all was swollen. Also, three small (about 2") rashes: under chin and inside both wrists. Stayed swollen 48 hours before selling medical care. Could not think of anything I had a reaction to. No new laundry soap, pillow, food, drink, facial product. Only thing done that I'd never done or used or had before was I spent 2 hours on the deck of an indoor swimming pool. 48 hours after onset, I visited virtual care Doctor. Prescribed Zyrtec (once daily) and opthalmic erythromycin. Started at bedtime, woke up to eyes more swollen than before. Visited walk in clinic and told to stop erythromycin, start famotidine (20 mg twice daily x5 days) and prednisone (50 mg qd x3 days) and continue Zyrtec. Cleared within 2.5 days.

The patient noted that blood and a "clear liquid" was running down his arm.  He stated that it was 1/16th to 3/32nds inch wide and ran to the level of the elbow. (This occurred while the vaccinator was looking away and disposing of the syringe in the sharps container.)  It was wiped up and pressure was applied to the site without further problem.  Upon reaching home he thought about this and then wondered if he had received a complete dose. He then contacted the health department and I contacted him in follow up. In discussing this with the vaccinee and the vaccinator, NP, her immediate impression was that this was blood only but admits that perhaps a portion of vaccine could have been mixed in as well.  This was discussed with the vaccinee and I feel that greater than half of the vaccine was s\administered so no repeat dose will be given. He will return for his 2nd dose in 21-42 days.

This is a serious study case initially received on 26-Nov-2018, concerning a 28-year-old adult, female, pregnant subject of body weight 159 lbs, height 62.6 inches and body mass index (BMI) 28.5, a study on pregnancy outcomes in women immunized with seasonal cell culture influenza trivalent (TIVc) or quadrivalent (QIVc) vaccine during pregnancy. The subject did not have any obstetrical history. The subject had no history of offspring with major congenital malformation. Also, the subject had no maternal/paternal history with major congenital malformations. The subject didn't have a prior history of use of tobacco, alcohol or illicit drugs during pregnancy. The subject was allergic to drug (cephalothin). The subject's last menstrual period date was 20-Aug-2018. At the gestational age of 10 weeks the pregnancy subject's pregnancy was collected, and no complications were noted. The type of pregnancy was reported as singleton. On 03-Nov-2018, the subject was administered Flu Vaccine Cell Subunit QIV NVD (batch number: 252232, dose, route of administration, expiry date and anatomical location: not reported) for an unknown indication (explicitly considered as exposure during pregnancy). On an unspecified date, after vaccination, the subject's pregnancy complication was reported as oligohydramnios. On 10-Nov-2018, the subject's cystic fibrosis mutation analysis showed no any congenital malformation. On 14-Nov-2018, the subject's first trimester screening showed no congenital malformation. From 15-Nov-2018, the subject started using OB complete (300mg, orally, qid) for healthy pregnancy and the medication is ongoing. On 08-Dec-2018, the subject's second trimester screening showed no congenital malformation. The subject's estimated date of delivery was reported as 27-Nov-2019. The outcome of the event oligohydramnios was not reported. Follow-up received from other health professional on 13-Dec-2018: The reporter updated the details of OB-complete medication (dose, units, frequency, start date and status). The same was amended in the narrative. Follow-up received from other health professional on 03-Apr-2019: The case was updated from non-serious to serious as a new event Oligohydramnios was added. It was reported that, on 08-Dec-2018, the subject's second trimester screening showed no congenital malformation. The narrative was amended accordingly.; Reporter's Comments: A 28-year-old pregnant subject was administered Flu Vaccine Cell Subunit QIV at 10 weeks of gestational age (explicitly considered as vaccine exposure during pregnancy). The subject experienced oligohydramnios, unspecified period post vaccination. Considering the lack of information important for the causality assessment such as onset latency between the vaccination and reported event, more plausible causes/alternate aetiologies, the company assessed the causality of event oligohydramnios as unassessable. The causality of the event vaccine exposure during pregnancy assessed as not related to study vaccine, considering the intended use of the vaccine. The case will be further assessed upon receipt of follow up information. The company assessed the event oligohydramnios as serious (Medically significant).

Next morning, I could not raise my arm from the pain.  Every day since, I have had another wave of the same pains once in the morning and then again in the evening.   Each wave lasted 1 to 2 hours. Today my arm is better, I could move it normally.

Since my previous blood test two months before had shown that I was stable, we determined that the vaccine caused a relapse.

right central retinal vein occlusion with macular edema; right central retinal vein occlusion with macular edema; congestive heart failure; This initial spontaneous report was received from a lawyer regarding a case in litigation and refers to a female patient of an unknown age. No information was provided regarding medical history, concurrent conditions, or concomitant medications. On or around 20-DEC-2016, the patient was vaccinated with a dose of zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) (exact dose, dose number, route and site of administration, lot# and expiration date were not reported) for routine health maintenance and for its intended purpose: the prevention of shingles (herpes zoster). Shortly after receiving the zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX), the patient suffered vision loss in right eye and intermittent graying of vision and was diagnosed with right central retinal vein occlusion with macular edema. The patient also suffered congestive heart failure. As a direct and proximate result of zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) use, the patient's symptoms have resulted in physical limitations not present prior to the vaccination. The patient also experienced mental and emotional distress due to resulting physical limitation and seriousness of her condition. As a result of the zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) use, the patient sustained severe and permanent personal injuries. Further, as a tragic consequence of zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) use, the patient suffered serious, progressive, permanent and incurable injuries, as well as significant conscious pain and suffering, mental anguish, emotional distress, loss of enjoyment of life, physical impairment and injury. As a direct and proximate result of zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) use, the patient has suffered and incurred damages, including medical expenses; the loss of accumulations; and other economic and non-economic damages. The outcome of the events was reported as not recovered. The relatedness between the events and zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) was reported as related.  The events of congestive heart failure and right central retinal vein occlusion with macular edema were considered to be disabling.  Upon internal review, the events of congestive heart failure and right central retinal vein occlusion with macular edema were considered to be medically significant.

Patient reported to medical clinic 24 hours after COVID 19 injection (03/19/2021) with symptoms of visual hallucinations, myalgia, rigors, headache, nausea, vomiting and dehydration.  At the time of arrival to the medical clinic, he had refractory nausea and vomiting after receiving Zofran earlier in the day at another clinical site. Medical treatment consisted of IV Fluid bolus with maintenance fluids, IV Phenergan for the nausea and vomiting, and IV Ketorolac for headache pain. His symptoms resolved and he started to feel better so a clinical decision was made to discharge him home in the care of a close friend. He planned to follow-up the next day.   The patient returned to  medical Clinic on 03/22/2021 with no specific symptoms. Previous symptoms from initial encounter resolved according to medical chart. Patient returned on 03/28/2021 with right upper arm DVT proven on U/S. He was seen at Primary Care Clinic beforehand where diagnosis of DVT was made. He was then started on anticoagulation therapy by MD in clinic after specialist phone consult, and will be closely followed. He was sent to Evacuation  to home station due to the complexity of the condition, medications, etc.

At 1:12 pm, RRT was called and 4 RNs responded to the scene. Stethoscope, pulse ox, and emergency kit brought to scene. Client reports feeling pins and needles in the back of her head. She feels that her tongue and neck are swollen but as assessed, they were not swollen. She also reports feeling tingling in her tongue and neck. She was AAOx4, in no acute distress, no SOB noted. Skin and lip color normal, cap refill <3 seconds. Heart and lung sounds normal. Vitals: BP: 128/80, HR: 90, O2: 99% on RA, RR: 18. She did not report any pain. EMS was not called at this time. It was decided by RRT team that client can be monitored for an additional 30 minutes. RN stayed with client throughout 30-minute monitoring period. RN stated that during monitoring period, client was fine but kept reporting that she felt a lump in her throat. Husband talking with RN revealed that client is not diagnosed with anxiety but does have it. At the end of her 30-minute monitoring period at 1:40 pm, RRT was called again. RN already with client and client reported that she felt tingling everywhere again all over her body and felt like she could not breathe. Additionally, she had that feeling of being embarrassed with the sudden rush of heat throughout her body. Additional RN's arrived to scene at 1:41 pm. Upon assessment, she was not SOB but had rapid breathing associated with anxiousness and nervousness, which she reported. RN noticed client's hands and arms were shaking and client stated it was because she was nervous. Client speaking in full sentences. At this point, RRT RNs decided that client needs 911 assistance which was activated by Fire Chief on site. RNs also assessed that client's tongue was swollen again. Heart and lungs sounds were normal. Vitals at 1:49 pm: HR: 102, BP: 144/70, O2: 95%, RR: 21. At this point, on the basis of the symptoms she was experiencing, RN's decided to administer Benadryl 50 mg IM that was in the emergency kit. When the decision was made, client was asked if it was okay to administer Benadryl IM. She was explained the purpose of Benadryl, the side effects, and risks and benefits. Client consented to receiving Benadryl IM. Benadryl 50 mg IM administered to RA by RN at 13:51. By 13:53, her tongue was not swollen anymore. At 13:58, she was not SOB anymore, talking in full sentences, no acute distress, tingling stopped. By 13:59, the same symptoms of tingling throughout her body, feeling a sudden heat rush throughout her body started again. HR: 65, RR: 21, O2 95%. At 14:01, EMS arrives, truck number 341, vitals stable on their end. At 14:04, client decided to go to RUHS via ambulance. One of the paramedics stated that client's hands were "cold as ice". At 14:07, report was given to paramedics/ambulance and client was in the ambulance. Care assumed by ambulance/paramedics.

Pre-term delivery; Retained placenta with postpartum hemorrhage; Retained placenta with postpartum hemorrhage; Eclampsia; Mild pre-eclampsia; Vaccine exposure during pregnancy; This is an observational study case, initially received from other health professional on 20-Dec-2019, concerning a 32-year-old pregnant, female subject of body weight 150 lbs, height 66 inches and body mass index (BMI) 24.2,  enrolled in, a prospective observational safety study.  The subject's medical history included anxiety, depression and gestational diabetes.   The subject's concomitant medications included trazodone and sertraline, both used for anxiety and depression and Prenatal vitamins (unspecified vitamins) as supplement.  The subject had one previous pregnancy that ended as elective abortion.  The subject had no maternal/paternal history with major congenital malformation (MCM).  The subject's last menstrual period (LMP) date was 03-Mar-2019. The type of pregnancy was singleton. The subject's estimated delivery date (EDD) and corrected estimated delivery date (CEDD) were both 08-Dec-2019. The subject did not consume tobacco, alcohol and illicit-drugs during pregnancy.  On 02-Jul-2019, the subject performed Inheritest and maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein (MSAFP/serum markers) no and no MCM was noted.  On 10-Jul-2019 and on 10-Sep-2019, the subject underwent ultrasound and no MCM was noted.  On 16-Oct-2019, at gestational age of 32 weeks, the patient was administered Afluria QIV [influenza vaccine, batch number: P100118566, dose, route of administration, anatomical location and expiration date: not reported] for influenza immunisation (explicitly coded as 'Vaccine exposure during pregnancy').  On 25-Oct-2019, nine days after vaccination, the subject developed mild pre-eclampsia. On the same day, the subject underwent ultrasound and no MCM was noted.  On 31-Oct-2019, the subject started treatment with betamethasone for pre-eclampsia at a dose of 12.5 mg, twice a day via intramuscular route of administration.  On an unspecified date in Nov-2019, the patient developed eclampsia.  On 10-Nov-2019, at gestational age of 36 weeks, the subject vaginally delivered female neonate. The subject had retained placenta and experienced postpartum hemorrhage. The birth weight of the neonate was 2183 g, there were no data for head circumference and length. Appearance, pulse, grimace, activity and respiration (APGAR) score at one minute was 4, at five minutes was 7 and no data was reported for APGAR score at ten minutes. No MCM was identified at birth.  At the time of initial report, the outcome of all events, except vaccine exposure during pregnancy, was not reported.  This case is linked to case 201907460 (the corresponding child case).  The events of eclampsia, pre-eclampsia, preterm delivery and retained placenta with haemorrhage were considered serious due to the criterion of medical significance.  The reporter did not provide causality assessment to Afluria QIV.  Company comment: The subject experienced eclampsia, pre-eclampsia, premature delivery, postpartum haemorrhage and retained placenta associated with administration of Afluria QIV. The patient was administered vaccine at approximately 32 weeks of gestation. Chronology is plausible. However, causality was highly confounded by medical history of gestational diabetes. Regarding the events postpartum haemorrhage and retained placenta, risk factors (age over 30 and premature delivery) may have contributed to development of the events. Causal role of the suspect vaccine cannot be totally excluded and is assessed as unlikely related. Vaccine exposure during pregnancy is assessed as unrelated per company's conventions.; Sender's Comments: The subject experienced eclampsia, pre-eclampsia, premature delivery, postpartum haemorrhage and retained placenta associated with administration of Afluria QIV. The patient was administered vaccine at approximately 32 weeks of gestation. Chronology is plausible. However, causality was highly confounded by medical history of gestational diabetes. Regarding the events postpartum haemorrhage and retained placenta, risk factors (age over 30 and premature delivery) may have contributed to development of the events. - Sore left arm for about 48 hours; took Tylenol; seemed to help a little. - About 13 hours after vaccine was administered came down with severe chills and body aches; lasted about 6 hours; unable to sleep most of the night; exhausted that morning; groggy, achy, and hard to focus during the day; took a nap and got extra sleep that night; felt a little tired the following day but other than that, felt 100% (even got in a workout at the gym).

Monday at 2:00 I received my vaccine.   Tuesday, The morning after I received the vaccine I had gone to work. I started to feel like I was coming down with the flu. I started  to feel very tired and almost weak. I stayed at work as I?m a caretaker for two young children, but  I began to feel more and more achy and my joints began to hurt. I drove home at 4:30 and cranked up the heat my hands were so cold they felt like ice. I cranked up the heat. My face became extremely red and my cheeks brilliant red and flushed. I had taken a Tylenol the day of the vaccine and a Tylenol that morning and I took another Tylenol when I got home. I went straight to the couch and spent the next few hours in sweats and feeling generally lousy with aches and pains and joint pain and generally cursing those responsible for this disease process I was now experiencing. I felt much better by 10 o?clock this morning, Wednesday, but by noon was suffering from nausea. Trying to get up and do a few small things but generally having to stay quiet as I just don?t feel very good.

0n 03/10/2021, that evening I was lethargic, fatigue, and was in bed for that day and the next day. My symptoms resolved in 48 hours.  Around the beginning of May, I was having shortness of breath. I could not breathe-in while I was mowing the lawn. On 06/01/2021- Dr. diagnosed me with pneumonia. And he found multiple nodules in my lungs, one was about 2cm,  in my lungs.   On 10/08/2021, I have a follow up appointment to have another CT scan to see if the nodules have become larger.   I am not saying the vaccine caused the pneumonia. I'm just saying this all happened after the vaccine.

Several days after my first dose a broke out in hives/rash all over my arms legs and body. I have intense uncontrollable itching and skin is burning and painful. I feel hot (flushed), achy and unwell. This has disrupted my daily activities and interfered with sleep   I went to my regular doctor first and was started on prednisone.  I went back 2 days later because I didn?t see an improvement.  They gave a medrol dose pack of steroids. Later that night it continued to get worse so I went into the ER.  Was treated there with solumedrol, and benedryl by IV.  Left that night but returned again to the ER the next day because of unbearable pain in stomach and violent throwing up that wouldn?t stop.  They treated me with pain medication, solumedrol, benedryl and epinephrine. On March 24th I was able to see the allergist Dr and he treated me with 2 antihistamines  and steroid.   3 days later I was worse so he saw me again and gave me injection of dexamethazone steroid shot.  That helped me get through the weekend. So by the next week he dropped to taking 6mg if dexamethazone and continuing this whole time with the antihistamine regimens he prescribed.  Dr has diagnosed me with a ?type IV delayed allergic reaction?. Unfortunately these take weeks or even a couple months to resolve.  It calms and flares again repeatedly.

1) Pain around the location of the first shot.  The pain went away after a couple of days. 2) Chills, fatigue, and body ache after the second shot.  They all went away after 2 days.  However, 2 days ago (June 2, 2021) - that is 2 months after the second shot (April 2, 2021), I started to have chills, fatigue, body ache, and some low fever (99.5), the same exact feelings that I had right after the second shot!  I took one pill of ibuprofen and it helped with the body ache.  However, fatigue did not go away until 2 days later (June 4, 2021).  I was worried and thought I had caught covid, so I got tested, and the result was negative!  Today, June 4, 2021, I got up and felt like myself again!    What is the possibility that the side effect keeps coming back like this?  I asked the nurse, who informed me about my negative result, this question, and she said that I might have caught a bug!  I told her that it was unlikely I would have recovered quickly if that had happened!

I am submitting this because I know there has been limited data on the effect of the vaccine on people with autoimmune issues.  I was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis March 2020.  Dietary changes have kept my rheumatoid arthritis in check -- not requiring any medication, even ibuprofen -- since May or June 2020.  Within 24 hours of receiving the J&J vaccine, my knees, ankles, hands, wrists, and feet began to hurt.  (I also had a 100 degree fever for 24 hours.)  Unfortunately, 2.5 weeks later, the joint pain persists.  The vaccine clearly triggered a flare up, but I hope that within another 2 weeks, the vaccine will have finishing tweaking my immune system for COVID response and the pain will abate.  I do not know yet if that will be the case.

Tired, can't sleep; Tired, can't sleep; Heart racing, described as irregular arrhythmia; Heart racing, described as irregular arrhythmia/Heart pounding, hard pounding; Arm barely sore; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 72-years-old female patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine), at the age of 72-years-old , via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 31Mar2021 11:40 am as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing food allergy, she had anaphylactic shock from a food allergy (she was 40 at the time and she doesn't eat anything she is allergic to), sinus infection and then got horrible hives under her eyes. No Prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks). Concomitant medication was eye drops every night. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer Suspect. The patient previously took epipen had two episodes when she was 40. She is bad about carrying her EpiPen, she forgets it. She was allergic to Amoxicillin. At 11:40 am last Wednesday patient had the vaccine, and around 4 or 5 pm, her heart started pounding for 10 seconds, and it felt like forever. An hour later, her heart started pounding again. It happened twice an hour apart and the second time lasted longer. It described as hard pounding. It started at 4 or 5 pm and then for 4.5 hours there was nothing, but then her heart started racing. At around 4 or 5 pm her heart was pounding, than around 9:30 pm her heart started racing and beating fast, she could feel it. She lives in a rural community and her husband called the local fire station and asked if he could take her there, to the station, so that she could have her heart checked. She was hooked up to a monitor and the paramedics said that she had an irregular arrhythmia and needed to go to the hospital by ambulance. Her heart rate was 115 to 130 beats, then 140 beats, at the hospital. It was about 11pm when she was evaluated and then left in the ambulance, as she was 45 minutes from the hospital. The paramedics would have, the arrhythmia, on record and that 5 minutes before she got to the hospital, the paramedic said her heart rhythm was normal. She was not admitted to the hospital, but held in observation and left the hospital at 4:30 in the morning. She hasn't felt anything after that. it was only one time she thought her heart was going faster, after that, but it didn't happen again. It is currently no problem and even at the hospital, the heart racing stopped and it was normal. The doctor in the emergency room said she was totally normal. Her arm was barely sore, when touched, and noticed this when she was being helped to the bathroom in the emergency room, maybe later in the afternoon, it was not hurting. But she didn't have any other events. She was tired the next day on 01Apr2021. She was up all night in the emergency room. people say that one will be tired, as an effect, but she can't say that it is because of the vaccine, or if she only had 3 hours of sleep. She hasn't been sleeping but she can't attribute it to the vaccine. She can't attribute this to the vaccine, that she has been tired lately and not sleeping. Event outcome of irregular arrhythmia and Heart racing, described as irregular arrhythmia/Heart pounding, hard pounding was recovered on 31Mar2021, of Arm barely sore was recovered on 02Apr2021, of the remaining was unknown.  Information about Batch/Lot number has been requested.

On 10-OCT-2019, the nurse at the pediatric center administered Hepatitis A Vaccine, Inactivated (VAQTA), lot# S021092 with expiry date of 18-MAY-2020 and the plunger of the prefilled syringe broke and cut the nurse's finger (Wound, Accidental exposure to product, Occupational exposure to product and Exposure via skin contact). The broken Hepatitis A Vaccine, Inactivated (VAQTA) syringe could not be retrieved from the pediatric centre because it was discarded. Outcome and causality of the events were not reported. According with the reporter, the body of the syringe did not break, it was only the finger flange where the nurse placed her thumb what broke. Besides, it was stated that the patient did not miss the dose of the medication, because the nurse used a different syringe for the administration of the medication, the broken syringe was not used on the patient.  As there were no contact between the medication and the nurse the events accidental exposure to product, occupational exposure to product and exposure via skin contact were deleted. A 15-year-old female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Solution for injection; Lot number: EW0179; expiration date: 31Aug2021) via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 12Jun2021 (at the age of 15-year-old) for COVID-19 immunization. Patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Solution for injection; Lot number: EW0183) in unspecified route of administration in left arm on 22May2021 (at the age of 15-year-old) for COVID-19 immunization and had no reaction. On 13Jun2021, one day after vaccination, the patient had 103 fever, headache, nausea, body aches and on 14Jun2021, two days after vaccination, the patient experienced vomiting. As per the reporter, patient was getting the side effect for 5 days now. She had 103 fever for day and half. She was experiencing severe headache. Now, she was experiencing headache, nausea, vomiting and body aches. Reportedly, It was started when she had the second vaccination, started on Sunday and Monday she had a fever and had experience headache and body aches and then on Tuesday fever went away and she started experiencing headache, nausea and vomiting still going on. Reporter's daughter received the vaccine shot, the second one, last Saturday, she was still experiencing side effects. She was having nausea, headache, body ache, and she had 103 fever for three days. Reporter mentioned that they were trying to find out what treatment should they give her. Outcome of the event 103 fever was resolved on 16Jun2021 and for the event headache, nausea, pain and vomiting were not resolved.  No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

I became weak and thought I was going to faint. I called the medical professional over and they brought me into a staged area for triage. My blood pressure was 171/ 104 or 114. I had chest pain. The EMT did and EKG, listened to my heart, and started an IV. The ambulance was called and I was transported by ambulance to the hospital. At the hospital another EKG was taken, blood pressure and blood work. Repeated blood work was taken. I was admitted to the hospital due to elevation of tyoponin level and chest pain. The following day 1/22/21 I saw my PCP and he thought it was related to the vaccine and recommended a cardiologist for the increased levels of tyoponin and chest pain.  The cardiologist performed another EKG< more blood work and performed a cardiac catheterization and a ECO. Both were normal. Prior to that I was given a nitro pill as my chest pain was between a 7 and a 8; a few minutes later the nurse asked about my pain level and it was a 3-4. I was given another nitro pill and shortly after I felt extremely faint and my blood pressure was 56/32. I was immediately given a bolus of saline IV . The chest pain continued through the day. The following day, I had no further chest pain, my tyoponin levels returned to normal and I was released from the hospital.

Client reported that she had the vaccine yesterday around 10:45 am. At the time she felt a little lightheaded and her arm was sore. She went to sleep at 1130pm on the day she received her vaccine. At 4am the following morning, she woke up and her whole body was convulsing--the muscles in her arms and legs were shaking, her hands were balled into fists, and her jaw was clenched. She reported that her husband woke up and asked her if she was ok to which we was able to respond, but cannot remember what she said. She reports that her husband said the episode lasted 3-4 minutes, but that she felt like it lasted an hour. When the episode was over, she was spacey and confused. She did not get out of bed. 10 minutes later, a second episode occurred. This time her left arm and right leg began convulsing, but the rest of her body was unaffected. This episode lasted 2-3 minutes and then ended.

Administered vials that were exposed to room temperature for more than 12 hours; A spontaneous report was received from an employee and a physician concerning a patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and was administered with product that was exposed to room temperature for more than twelve hours.   The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported.   On 04 Jan 2021, a freezer containing a vial of mRNA-1273 failed.  At 1:11 A.M. the vial experienced a temperature excursion, exceeding 8 degrees Celsius. Over time the dose thawed and reached room temperature.  On 04 Jan 2021, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection and was administered with product that was exposed to room temperature for more than twelve hours.  No treatment information was provided.  Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was not reported.   The event, administered with product that was exposed to room  temperature for more than twelve hours, was resolved on 04 Jan 2021.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a patient of unknown gender and age who received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot unknown), reporting Product that was exposed to room temperature for more than twelve hours without any associated adverse events.

The outcome of the event was not recovered.; Sender's Comments: Based on the available information, the known safety profile and the temporal association of BNT162B2 administration to the event, a possible contribution of the drug to the event of BPPV cannot be excluded.  The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Asthma flare up; dry, hacky cough; pain and tightness in her chest; pain and tightness in her chest; nausea feeling in her chest; She gets this laryngitis; has trouble talking; She wants to make sure its not going into like a viral pneumonia; Flu-like symptoms; fever; achy; fatigue; Sore arm; Headache; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable pharmacist (patient). A 68-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; solution for injection; Lot Number: CER230) via an unspecified route of administration on 24Mar2021 at 11:30 (at the age of 68-years-old) as a single dose in the right arm for COVID-19 immunisation. The medical history included flu and suspected COVID-19 both in Jan2020 to an unspecified date (she had a bad flu back in Jan2020, which could have been COVID because it was such a bad flu, over a year ago), ongoing asthma from an unspecified date (mild asthma) and chest nausea in Jan2020 to an unspecified date. The patient had no history of any adverse events following prior vaccinations. Medical history (including any illness at time of vaccination) was also reported as none. Family medical history relevant to the adverse event included an uncle that had asthma, but no one else had breathing issues. Concomitant medications included fluticasone propionate/salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR) and ipratropium bromide/salbutamol sulfate (DUONEB), both ongoing and taken for asthma on unspecified dates. Other products were also reported as "no". The patient did not receive any prior vaccinations within 4 weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine and did not receive any additional vaccines on the same date as the COVID-19 vaccine. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; solution for injection; Lot Number: 3N6202) via an unspecified route of administration on 24Feb2021 at 11:30 (at the age of 68-years-old) as a single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunisation. On 24Mar2021 the patient experienced sore arm and headache; on 25Mar2021 the patient experienced flu-like symptoms, fever, achy, fatigue; on 02Apr2021 the patient experienced asthma flare up, dry, hacky cough, pain and tightness in her chest, nausea feeling in her chest; on unspecified dates in Apr2021 the patient experienced she gets this laryngitis, has trouble talking and she wants to make sure its not going into like a viral pneumonia. The reporter classified the events headache and flu-like symptoms as non-serious. The patient called to report that she had an asthma flare up 10 days (as reported) after her second dose of COVID-19 vaccine on 24Mar2021. The patient stated that she did not get a flare up often, she had mild asthma. She usually got mild flare-ups since she did not have severe asthma. She stated it could be something else, but she had not had a flare-up like this since she had a bad flu back in Jan2020, which could have been COVID-19 because it was such a bad flu. That was over a year ago. She received her second vaccine on 24Mar2021, and the asthma flare up and hacking cough started on 02Apr2021. On the night of 24Mar2021, she started with a headache. She had the shot at 11 something and by that evening before she went to bed, she had a headache and a sore arm, but that was no big deal. Then on 25Mar2021, she started with flu like symptoms/fever. The headache persisted through that as well. At that point, she did not have tightness or the dry, hacky cough. By the middle of the day on 27Mar2021, her flu-like symptoms were gone. She would consider these to be "non-serious", it was what she expected, as it was seen from the paperwork of the vaccine. By 28Mar2021, all of her symptoms were gone prior to the flare-up. She had typical flu-like symptoms: fever, headache, achy, fatigue on the 2nd, 3rd, and into the 4th day but then they cleared up. By the evening of the 4th day, she started feeling fairly normal. She stated that they were mild flu symptoms. Her temperature was only 100 for about a day. She stated that that was expected. Then, she went into this flare-up about the 10th day after the vaccine. The first 3 or 4 days after the flare up began, the flare up was worsening. Then, she got it under a little bit of control, so she was not coughing all night and having to sit up as she was sleeping. Now, she was concerned about the pain and tightness in her chest and the hacky cough. She wanted to make sure it was not going into like a viral pneumonia or another thing. She did not know. She kept increasing her Advair use and was at the top of that. She was doing the duoneb which she did not usually have to do. She had not had to do that since Jan2020 when she had the 5-week flu, or it could have been COVID (they were calling it a hoax back then). She was using her duoneb 4 times a day and now she was using it to 2-3 times, but she was still getting chest tightness, hacky cough. It was kind of like nausea- it was hard to explain, it was kind of like a chest nausea, which she had also had back in Jan2020 when she had the bad flu. She also would get this laryngitis and had trouble talking. With her flare-up, her chest tightness/nausea feeling in the chest continued. Now, she was getting into laryngitis type of thing, but she could loosen that up with her duoneb but if she got to the point where she could not do that, she would definitely have to see someone right away. She clarified that when her chest got tight, the dry, hacky cough continued/increased. When she did the breathing treatment, it loosened it up for about 3-4 hours and some of the pain would go away in her chest. If she talked too much, she would begin to cough. She had had this flare up 3 times in her life, it was not very common. She was diagnosed with asthma in her 40s, and this was her 3rd time ever having anything like this. This was the first time she had experienced a flare up like this. She had had 3 episodes since she had had asthma in her 40's and all 3 bad episodes were about the same. All the episodes were related to illness, it did not just happen out of the blue. It happened with a viral respiratory thing or the flu. The adverse events did not require a visit to the emergency room or physician office. The patient stated that she would call her physician or the clinic "today or tomorrow". She had not been to a doctor since her asthma flared up. Her respiratory doctor/pulmonologist moved away, there was no respiratory doctor nearby right now. So, her general practitioner was following her because it was a mild case and she had mild asthma. If it was severe, her doctor would make her go to a specialist. Relevant tests were reported as no. The patient used to be followed with pulmonary function tests until her respiratory doctor moved away. The patient stated that she took care of her 94 year old mother several days a week and because of all of the variances coming out, she thought it was her civic duty to prevent it from spreading through the population and creating more variances which was why she received the vaccine. She stated her doses were scheduled a month apart because they expecting to get a shipment of Moderna and they did not. They had to run to Buffalo to get the Pfizer vaccine, but they left her doses scheduled a month apart because the appointments were so hard to get. Normally, it would be 3 weeks. Her card clearly said Pfizer and they told her Pfizer, and they told her the reason for it being scheduled at 4 weeks. The patient called to inquire whether asthma flare-ups had been seen in clinical trials. It was not a reported side effect from the paperwork she received. When she looked online, she could not really find anything. She was thinking of going to a clinic but was wondering if there were any reports of flare-ups with asthma with the vaccine. With regards to causality, the patient stated it was a concern because she usually did not get a flare-up unless she was sick. She stated that there were many variables, and that it was spring, and bugs were out, but she did not usually get a flare-up like this. She stated that maybe it was a challenge to her immune system, the antibodies, but she did not know. She suspected the flare-up was related to the vaccine, but she did not have any idea. She would say yes, but she had no way of knowing. The flare-up usually only appeared if she got ill or something weird happened to her.  The clinical outcomes of the events flu-like symptoms, fever, achy and fatigue were recovered/resolved on 27Mar2021; sore arm and headache were recovered/resolved on 28Mar2021; asthma flare up, dry, hacky cough, pain and tightness in her chest and nausea feeling in her chest were not recovered/not resolved; she gets this laryngitis, has trouble talking and she wants to make sure its not going into like a viral pneumonia were unknown. The reporter believed there was a reasonable possibility that the events sore arm, flu-like symptoms, asthma flare-up, dry, hacky cough, pain and tightness in her chest and nausea feeling in her chest were related to BNT162B2.   No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on the available information the events asthma flare-ups and viral pneumonia are attributed to intercurrent medical conditions, unlikely related to BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE). The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

History of Present Illness  The patient presents with weakness.  The course/duration of symptoms is constant.  The character of symptoms is generalized.  The degree at present is moderate.  Associated symptoms: abdominal pain.  73 y/o M who comes in from home for generalized weakness. PT states that he was feeling well until after he went to bed tonight. around 1 am he attempted to get up and go to the bathroom and his wife had to help him. She was able to get him up and he went to the bathroom but he seemed more shakey than usual. He then tried to get back up around 230 am and he was very shakey, said he was cold, and he could tno stand. She attempted to stand him up and she was not able to get him up and move him at all because he was so generally weak. No fevers that he knows of. He did recieve his first dose of the covid vaccine this afternoon. He was well after that and went to dinner and was well until he went to sleep. He has a h/o HTN, HLD, and tremor. Pt did have covid in early december as well. .    Notes: 73 y/o M who comes in from home for generalized weakness. Pt is alert and awake but slower to respond than his usual per his wife. Labs are overall reassuring. His etemp is elevated but afebrile. CXR with possible atelectasis vs infiltrate but pt has no cough, no fever, and a normal WBC Coutn so I favor atelectasis. His CT head shows possibly artifact vs cortical hypodensities. Will await formal read this morning. Pts UA is clean. He is no longer shaking after a dose of tylenol and ativan. I suspect the pts generalzied weakess is 2/2 his recent covid vaccine yesterday afternoon. Despite this the pt cannot stand and move around on his own and his wife cannot care fo rhim at home given his current situation. Pt discussed with Dr and will be admitted for further care. .    Impression and Plan  Diagnosis  COVID-19 vaccine series started  Rigors  Tremor  Weakness  Weakness or fatigue  Plan  Condition: Improved, Stable.   Disposition: Admit time  3/12/2021 06:27:00
